t: “Moreover*p take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,
and say: ‘What*pn is*i your mother? A lioness: She*ld lay down among the lions; Among*ld the young lions she nourished her cubs.
She*ld brought up one of her cubs, And*ld he became a young lion; He*ld learned to catch prey, And*ld he devoured men.
The*ld nations also heard of him; He*ld was trapped in their pit, And*ld they brought him with chains to the land of Egypt.
‘When*ln she saw that she waited, that*i her hope was lost, She*ld took another of her cubs and*i made him a young lion.
He*ld roved among the lions, And*ld became a young lion; He*ld learned to catch prey; He*ld devoured men.
He*ld knew their desolate places, And*ld laid waste their cities; The*ld land with its fullness was desolated By*ld the noise of his roaring.
Then*ld the nations set against him from the provinces on every side, And*ld spread their net over him; He*ld was trapped in their pit.
They*ld put him in a cage with chains, And*ld brought him to the king of Babylon; They*ld brought him in nets, That*ld his voice should no longer be heard on the mountains of Israel.
‘Your*ln mother was*i like a vine in your bloodline, Planted*ld by the waters, Fruitful*ld and full of branches Because*ld of many waters.
She*ld had strong branches for scepters of rulers. She*ld towered in stature above the thick branches, And*ld was seen in her height amid the dense foliage.
But*ld she was plucked up in fury, She*ld was cast down to the ground, And*ld the east wind dried her fruit. Her*ld strong branches were broken and withered; The*ld fire consumed them.
And*ld now she is*i planted in the wilderness, In*ld a dry and thirsty land.
Fire*ld has come out from a rod of her branches And*ild devoured her fruit, So*ld that she has no strong branch— a scepter for ruling.’” This*p is*i a lamentation, and has become a lamentation.
